title: Global warming in USA

properties.name: Kenai Fjords National Park
properties.description: Posted by Sw6850   This is a recently born iceburg floating away from the Aialik Glacier in Kenai Fjords National Park, Alaska. by http://flickr.com

properties.name: Kivalina.
properties.description: Posted by Sw6850 alaskaThe tundra that surrounds Kivalina. The Brooks range stretches in the distance.

properties.name: Monterey Bay
properties.description: Posted by Sw6850 , , CAShorelince sea life such as limpets, snails, and sea stars in the 60-year period between 1931-1933 and 1993-1994 indicate that species\' ranges are shifting northwards, in response to warmer ocean and air temperatures.

properties.name: Northwestern Lagoon
properties.description: Posted by Sw6850 , , AKNorthwestern Glacier calves into Northwestern Lagoon. Small chunks fell from the face of the glacier a few times during the half hour our boat stayed in front of the glacier.

properties.name: SANTA BARBARA
properties.description: Posted by Sw6850 caHeavy rain. 21.74 inches (55.22 cm) of rain fell in February, 1998.

properties.name: Tallahassee, FL
properties.description: Posted by Sw6850 Tallahassee, FLthe view from my fith floor window, here in c, looking North. what I feel poor florida needs now, is about four cat 4 hurricanes back to back, everywheres in the state! wind out, or burn out! my lungs have problems with this, if it gets much worse, I will have to evacuate! I guess this is one reason why I have not taken many pictures of late, lots of dry dead grass and smoky skies, a bit like "death warmed over"! Who wants to enjoy seeing a region of the country slowly die!! (by freestone)

properties.name: Vernon City of Texas
properties.description: Posted by Sw6850 1830 Main St, Vernon, TX, 76384Same problem as Florida. Deadly heat wave, hotter than Florida. Dallas temperatures were over 100�F (37.8�C) for 15 straight days during summer, 1998. In addition, Texas suffers from heavy rain storm with 10-20 inch (25.4-50.8 cm) rainfall totals caused billion in damage and 31 deaths.

properties.name: Waimea Bay
properties.description: Posted by Sw6850 , , HIGlobal warming has made the beautiful ocean in Hawaii very warm and another result is rise of sea-level and coastal flooding. Sea level rise at Waimea Bay, along with coastal development, has contributed to considerable beach loss over the past 90 years.

properties.name: Washington National Cathedral
properties.description: Posted by Sw6850  Massachusetts Ave Nw, Washington, DCI took this photo of the Cherry Blossoms next to the National Cathedral in Washington, DC, from Bishop\'s Garden. by flickr.com
